properties.description:
The size of buffer for use in sequence files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.
properties.name: io.file.buffer.size

properties.description: A list of the compression codec classes that can be used for compression/decompression.
properties.name: io.compression.codecs

properties.description: The implementation for lzo codec.
properties.name: io.compression.codec.lzo.class

properties.description:
The name of the default file system.  Either the
  literal string "local" or a host:port for NDFS.
properties.name: fs.default.name

properties.description:
Number of minutes between trash checkpoints.
  If zero, the trash feature is disabled.
properties.name: fs.trash.interval

properties.description:
Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS secondary
        name node should store the temporary images to merge.
        If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the image is
        replicated in all of the directories for redundancy.
properties.name: fs.checkpoint.dir

properties.description:
Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS secondary
        name node should store the temporary edits to merge.
        If this is a comma-delimited list of directoires then the edits is
        replicated in all of the directoires for redundancy.
        Default value is same as fs.checkpoint.dir
properties.name: fs.checkpoint.edits.dir

properties.description: The number of seconds between two periodic checkpoints.
properties.name: fs.checkpoint.period

properties.description:
The size of the current edit log (in bytes) that triggers
       a periodic checkpoint even if the fs.checkpoint.period hasn't expired.
properties.name: fs.checkpoint.size

properties.description:
Defines the threshold number of connections after which
               connections will be inspected for idleness.
properties.name: ipc.client.idlethreshold

properties.description:
The maximum time after which a client will bring down the
               connection to the server.
properties.name: ipc.client.connection.maxidletime

properties.description: Defines the maximum number of retries for IPC connections.
properties.name: ipc.client.connect.max.retries

properties.description:
If set to true, the web interfaces of JT and NN may contain
                actions, such as kill job, delete file, etc., that should
                not be exposed to public. Enable this option if the interfaces
                are only reachable by those who have the right authorization.
properties.name: webinterface.private.actions

properties.description:
Set the authentication for the cluster. Valid values are: simple or
   kerberos.
properties.name: hadoop.security.authentication

properties.description: Enable authorization for different protocols.
properties.name: hadoop.security.authorization

properties.description:
The mapping from kerberos principal names to local OS user names.
  So the default rule is just "DEFAULT" which takes all principals in your default domain to their first component.
  "omalley@APACHE.ORG" and "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley", if your default domain is APACHE.ORG.
The translations rules have 3 sections:
      base     filter    substitution
The base consists of a number that represents the number of components in the principal name excluding the realm and the pattern for building the name from the sections of the principal name. The base uses $0 to mean the realm, $1 to mean the first component and $2 to mean the second component.

[1:$1@$0] translates "omalley@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley@APACHE.ORG"
[2:$1] translates "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley"
[2:$1%$2] translates "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley%admin"

The filter is a regex in parens that must the generated string for the rule to apply.

"(.*%admin)" will take any string that ends in "%admin"
"(.*@ACME.COM)" will take any string that ends in "@ACME.COM"

Finally, the substitution is a sed rule to translate a regex into a fixed string.

"s/@ACME\.COM//" removes the first instance of "@ACME.COM".
"s/@[A-Z]*\.COM//" removes the first instance of "@" followed by a name followed by ".COM".
"s/X/Y/g" replaces all of the "X" in the name with "Y"

So, if your default realm was APACHE.ORG, but you also wanted to take all principals from ACME.COM that had a single component "joe@ACME.COM", you'd do:

RULE:[1:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
DEFAULT

To also translate the names with a second component, you'd make the rules:

RULE:[1:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
RULE:[2:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
DEFAULT

If you want to treat all principals from APACHE.ORG with /admin as "admin", your rules would look like:

RULE[2:$1%$2@$0](.%admin@APACHE.ORG)s/./admin/
DEFAULT
properties.name: hadoop.security.auth_to_local

properties.description: Swift FileSystem implementation

properties.description:
Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node
      should store the name table.  If this is a comma-delimited list
      of directories then the name table is replicated in all of the
      directories, for redundancy.   Note that this value will be changed by the runtime if cinder volumes are specified for then node group configured with the NAMENODE node process
properties.name: dfs.name.dir

properties.description: to enable dfs append
properties.name: dfs.support.append

properties.description: to enable webhdfs
properties.name: dfs.webhdfs.enabled

properties.description: #of failed disks dn would tolerate
properties.name: dfs.datanode.failed.volumes.tolerated

properties.description:
the user who is allowed to perform short
    circuit reads.
properties.name: dfs.block.local-path-access.user

properties.description:
Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS data node
  should store its blocks.  If this is a comma-delimited
  list of directories, then data will be stored in all named
  directories, typically on different devices.
  Directories that do not exist are ignored.  Note that this value will be changed by the runtime if cinder volumes are specified for node groups configured with the DATANODE node process
properties.name: dfs.data.dir

properties.description:
The checksum method to be used by default. To maintain
    compatibility, it is being set to CRC32. Once all migration steps
    are complete, we can change it to CRC32C and take advantage of the
    additional performance benefit.
properties.name: dfs.checksum.type

properties.description: Maximal block replication.
properties.name: dfs.dx

properties.description: Default block replication.
properties.name: dfs.replication

properties.description: block replication max.
properties.name: dfs.replication.max

properties.description: Determines datanode heartbeat interval in seconds.
properties.name: dfs.heartbeat.interval

properties.description:
Specifies the percentage of blocks that should satisfy
        the minimal replication requirement defined by dfs.replication.min.
        Values less than or equal to 0 mean not to start in safe mode.
        Values greater than 1 will make safe mode permanent.
properties.name: dfs.safemode.threshold.pct

properties.description:
Specifies the maximum amount of bandwidth that each datanode
        can utilize for the balancing purpose in term of
        the number of bytes per second.
properties.name: dfs.balance.bandwidthPerSec

properties.description: The default block size for new files.
properties.name: dfs.block.size

properties.description:
The name of the default file system.  Either the
    literal string "local" or a host:port for NDFS.
properties.name: dfs.http.address

properties.description: Reserved space in bytes per volume. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.du.reserved

properties.description:
The datanode ipc server address and port.
    If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.ipc.address

properties.description: Delay for first block report in seconds.
properties.name: dfs.blockreport.initialDelay

properties.description: When calculating remaining space, only use this percentage of the real available space
properties.name: dfs.datanode.du.pct

properties.description: The number of server threads for the namenode.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.handler.count

properties.description: PRIVATE CONFIG VARIABLE
properties.name: dfs.datanode.max.xcievers

properties.description: The octal umask used when creating files and directories.
properties.name: dfs.umaskmode

properties.description:
The user account used by the web interface.
    Syntax: USERNAME,GROUP1,GROUP2, ...
properties.name: dfs.web.ugi

properties.description:
If "true", enable permission checking in HDFS.
    If "false", permission checking is turned off,
    but all other behavior is unchanged.
    Switching from one parameter value to the other does not change the mode,
    owner or group of files or directories.
properties.name: dfs.permissions

properties.description: The name of the group of super-users.
properties.name: dfs.permissions.supergroup

properties.description:
If "true", access tokens are used as capabilities for accessing datanodes.
    If "false", no access tokens are checked on accessing datanodes.
properties.name: dfs.block.access.token.enable

properties.description:
The HTTP Kerberos principal used by Hadoop-Auth in the HTTP endpoint.
      The HTTP Kerberos principal MUST start with 'HTTP/' per Kerberos
      HTTP SPENGO specification.
properties.name: dfs.web.authentication.kerberos.principal

properties.description:
The Kerberos keytab file with the credentials for the
      HTTP Kerberos principal used by Hadoop-Auth in the HTTP endpoint.

properties.description: The Kerberos principal that the DataNode runs as. "_HOST" is replaced by the real host name.

properties.description: The https address where namenode binds

properties.description:
The permissions that should be there on dfs.data.dir
    directories. The datanode will not come up if the permissions are
    different on existing dfs.data.dir directories. If the directories
    don't exist, they will be created with this permission.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.data.dir.perm

properties.description:
The access time for HDFS file is precise up to this value.
                 The default value is 1 hour. Setting a value of 0 disables
                 access times for HDFS.

properties.name: dfs.cluster.administrators

properties.description: The local directory where MapReduce stores intermediate data files. May be a comma-separated list of directories on different devices in order to spread disk i/o. Directories that do not exist are ignored. Note that this value will be changed by the runtime if cinder volumes are specified for node groups configured with the TASKTRACKER node process
properties.name: mapred.local.dir

If the job outputs are to compressed as SequenceFiles, how should

The number of milliseconds before a task will be

properties.name: io.sort.spill.percent

properties.description: No description
properties.name: io.sort.factor

properties.description:
If the map outputs are compressed, how should they be
      compressed
properties.name: mapred.map.output.compression.codec

properties.description: No description
properties.name: mapred.reduce.parallel.copies

properties.description:
The threshold, in terms of the number of files
  for the in-memory merge process. When we accumulate threshold number of files
  we initiate the in-memory merge and spill to disk. A value of 0 or less than
  0 indicates we want to DON'T have any threshold and instead depend only on
  the ramfs's memory consumption to trigger the merge.
properties.name: mapred.inmem.merge.threshold

properties.description:
The usage threshold at which an in-memory merge will be
  initiated, expressed as a percentage of the total memory allocated to
  storing in-memory map outputs, as defined by
  mapred.job.shuffle.input.buffer.percent.
properties.name: mapred.job.shuffle.merge.percent

properties.description:
The percentage of memory to be allocated from the maximum heap
  size to storing map outputs during the shuffle.
properties.name: mapred.job.shuffle.input.buffer.percent

properties.description:
The percentage of memory- relative to the maximum heap size- to
  retain map outputs during the reduce. When the shuffle is concluded, any
  remaining map outputs in memory must consume less than this threshold before
  the reduce can begin.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.input.buffer.percent

properties.description:
The limit on the input size of the reduce. (This value
    is 10 Gb.)  If the estimated input size of the reduce is greater than
    this value, job is failed. A value of -1 means that there is no limit
    set.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.input.limit

properties.description:
Amount of physical memory, in MB, that can be allocated
      for containers.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb

properties.description: Classpath for typical applications.
properties.name: yarn.application.classpath

properties.description:
Ratio between virtual memory to physical memory when
    setting memory limits for containers. Container allocations are
    expressed in terms of physical memory, and virtual memory usage
    is allowed to exceed this allocation by this ratio.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-pmem-ratio

properties.description: ContainerExecutor for launching containers
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.class

properties.description: Auxilliary services of NodeManager
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services

properties.description:
The interval, in milliseconds, for which the node manager

properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.interval-ms
